verses.text: And Naomi had a kinsman of her husband’s , a mighty man of wealth , of the family of Elimelech ; and his name \add was\add* Boaz.\f + \fr 2.1 \ft Boaz: Gr. Booz\f*
And Ruth the Moabitess said unto Naomi , Let me now go to the field , and glean ears of corn after \add him\add* in whose sight I shall find grace. And she said unto her, Go , my daughter.

And she went , and came , and gleaned in the field after the reapers : and her hap was to light on a part of the field \add belonging\add* unto Boaz , who \add was\add* of the kindred of Elimelech.\f + \fr 2.3 \ft hap…: Heb. hap happened\f* \p

¶ And, behold, Boaz came from Beth-lehem , and said unto the reapers , The 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* \add be\add* with you. And they answered him, The 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* bless thee.
Then said Boaz unto his servant that was set over the reapers , Whose damsel \add is\add* this?
And the servant that was set over the reapers answered and said , It \add is\add* the Moabitish damsel that came back with Naomi out of the country of Moab :
And she said , I pray you, let me glean and gather after the reapers among the sheaves : so she came , and hath continued even from the morning until now, that she tarried a little in the house.
Then said Boaz unto Ruth , Hearest thou not, my daughter ? Go not to glean in another field , neither go from hence, but abide here fast by my maidens :

\add Let\add* thine eyes \add be\add* on the field that they do reap , and go thou after them: have I not charged the young men that they shall not touch thee? and when thou art athirst , go unto the vessels , and drink of \add that\add* which the young men have drawn.
Then she fell on her face , and bowed herself to the ground , and said unto him, Why have I found grace in thine eyes , that thou shouldest take knowledge of me, seeing I \add am\add* a stranger ?

And Boaz answered and said unto her, It hath fully been shewed me, all that thou hast done unto thy mother in law since the death of thine husband : and \add how\add* thou hast left thy father and thy mother , and the land of thy nativity , and art come unto a people which thou knewest not heretofore.

The 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* recompense thy work , and a full reward be given thee of the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* God of Israel , under whose wings thou art come to trust.

Then she said , Let me find favour in thy sight , my lord ; for that thou hast comforted me, and for that thou hast spoken friendly unto thine handmaid , though I be not like unto one of thine handmaidens.\f + \fr 2.13 \ft Let me…: or, I find\f*\f + \fr 2.13 \ft friendly: Heb. to the heart\f*

And Boaz said unto her, At mealtime come thou hither , and eat of the bread , and dip thy morsel in the vinegar. And she sat beside the reapers : and he reached her parched \add corn\add*, and she did eat , and was sufficed , and left.
And when she was risen up to glean , Boaz commanded his young men , saying , Let her glean even among the sheaves , and reproach her not:\f + \fr 2.15 \ft reproach…: Heb. shame her not\f*
And let fall also \add some\add* of the handfuls of purpose for her, and leave \add them\add*, that she may glean \add them\add*, and rebuke her not. \p
So she gleaned in the field until even , and beat out that she had gleaned : and it was about an ephah of barley. \p
¶ And she took \add it\add* up , and went into the city : and her mother in law saw what she had gleaned : and she brought forth , and gave to her that she had reserved after she was sufficed.

And her mother in law said unto her, Where hast thou gleaned to day ? and where wroughtest thou? blessed be he that did take knowledge of thee. And she shewed her mother in law with whom she had wrought , and said , The man’s name with whom I wrought to day \add is\add* Boaz.

And Naomi said unto her daughter in law , Blessed \add be\add* he of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, who hath not left off his kindness to the living and to the dead. And Naomi said unto her, The man \add is\add* near of kin unto us, one of our next kinsmen.\f + \fr 2.20 \ft one of…: or, one that hath right to redeem\f*
And Ruth the Moabitess said , He said unto me also, Thou shalt keep fast by my young men , until they have ended all my harvest.

And Naomi said unto Ruth her daughter in law , \add It is\add* good , my daughter , that thou go out with his maidens , that they meet thee not in any other field.\f + \fr 2.22 \ft meet…: or, fall upon thee\f*
So she kept fast by the maidens of Boaz to glean unto the end of barley harvest and of wheat harvest ; and dwelt with her mother in law.
